intro: Bidens bampsiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf beggarlice, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as roadsides and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while its small yellow flowers bloom in the summer months. Bidens bampsiana is an annual plant that produces numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind and can persist in the soil for several years.
